questions.question: How does a Helmholtz resonator filled with water produce sound?

answers.a: When tuning fork resonate with air
answers.b: When tuning fork resonate with water

questions.question: What is the resonant frequency of a Helmholtz resonator?

answers.a: The frequency of the tuning fork
answers.b: The frequency at which the air inside the resonator vibrates most strongly
answers.c: The frequency at which the water inside the resonator vibrates most strongly

questions.question: If n is the frequency of the tuning fork and V is the resonating air volume, then for a particular resonator
If frequency of the tuning fork n1= 500Hz, resonating air volume V1= 100 cc, and n2=200 Hz, what is V2?

A beaker is having 1000 CC capacity and it is filled with 600 CC water. What could be the resonance frequency of a vibrating tuning fork kept above the neck. Given  n<sup>2</sup>V= 24x106s<sup>-2</sup> CC
